name: embitter
content:

to make someone feel embittered (= very angry about things that have happened to you): These attacks embitter or disillusion some soldiers. He did not allow his suffering to embitter him. See
embittered
More examplesFewer examplesThe constant killing of innocents is embittering a new generation.The debate embitters our attitude to other European countries and makes us forget how much we share.Romantic rejection is certain to embitter a man.
